entries.name: Snitch
entries.desc:
Pesky and vigilant, the Snitch is an unarmed reconnaissance drone, equipped with an advanced scanning technology. They are frequently found patrolling strategic areas or scouting ahead for other enemy units. If it detects any human threat, it calls in reinforcements from orbit.

The ability to call in reinforcements make Snitches a high-risk target for Raiders who want to avoid escalating encounters. However, some Raiders have been known to intentionally aggravate it in a bid to conveniently harvest Wasp and Hornet Drivers.

entries.name: Wasp
entries.desc:
The Wasp is a small, thruster-power drone, flying in tidy patrols with other Wasps and the occasional Hornet. When engaged they switch to erratic flight patterns, making them a challenging target. They are equipped with light guns, and seem to actively scan for potential threats, sometimes mistaking humanoid statues for Raiders.

The Wasp’s thrusters are exposed and unarmored, giving practiced Raiders a surefire way to send them crashing down.

entries.name: Hornet
entries.desc:
The Hornet is a small flying drone. Equipped with protective armor on its front side. It sports an electric shock-weapon that stuns and damages its targets.

It’s thought to be designed as an enhanced patrol unit, working with Wasps to neutralize immediate and potential threats to probing sites and other machines.

Like the Wasp damaging its thruster inhibits its flying capabilities. However, since the front thrusters are covered in armor, it takes a steady hand and skilled shot to reach them.

entries.name: Pop
entries.desc:
The Pop is a small unarmored rolling machine; often compared to the Fireball. It’s a quick impulsive enemy that often roams in swarms.

The Pop seems to have little regard for its own safety; carrying an explosive charge that “pops” upon impact, scorching any Raider that lets it get too close

entries.name: Fireball
entries.desc:
The Fireball is a fast-moving, ball-shaped ARC machine, usually spotted rolling around indoor areas. It spews fire at any perceived threat in its vicinity, roasting anyone not made out of fire-resistant materials.

With its speed and flame-throwing capabilities, it can cause great trouble for Raiders; in particular when encountered in groups or alongside Ticks.

entries.name: Tick
entries.desc:
The bane of anyone who values their face-adjacent personal space, the Tick is a small, spider-like machine that leaps at Raiders, munching away at whatever exposed skin it can find. It is predominantly found indoors, crawling on walls or ceilings.

The Tick is a relentless, parasitic creature that often attacks in small groups. While individual Ticks can be easily swatted off, hordes of them are another matter entirely.

entries.name: Turret
entries.desc:
The crude, stationary Turret can be found in buildings all over the Rust Belt. The unit is equipped with a sweeping scanner and a gun capable of unleashing barrages of bullets.

Although a nuisance, the Turret scanner emits visible light, allowing them to be avoided by attentive Raiders. It is also not particularly hard to destroy if spotted in time.

entries.name: Sentinel
entries.desc: The Sentinel is a medium unarmored turret ARC that sits atop buildings and ledges. It is always found outside and often in high locations overseeing an open area. Sentinels have a small vulnerable capsule attached to the rear of its swiveling arm.

entries.name: Rocketeer
entries.desc:
Looming grimly in the skies, the Rocketeer is a large, heavily-armored, long range artillery machine. It dominates open spaces with its powerful missile launchers. It can target Raiders from afar, creating hazardous zones that force Raiders to stay on the move or seek cover.

ARC seems to station Rocketeers in key areas; guarding high-threat locations, or just roaming and making life miserable for Raiders. They are able to eliminate fortified human resistance points in otherwise hard-to-reach locations.

Like the Wasp and the Hornet, it sports thrusters to stay airborne. While these thrusters are technically weak spots, they are large and take a significant amount of firepower to destroy.

entries.name: Leaper
entries.desc:
The Leaper is an agile, four-legged brute, often found stomping around open areas. This ARC is equipped with a powerful shockwave pulse that hits anyone nearby, and can leap at Raiders across astonishing distances. Historically, most Raiders have learned to avoid it altogether.

Leapers are commonly found in high-risk areas, guarding valuable objectives or patrolling alongside smaller, quicker enemies, thus creating layered threats that can be hard to deal with.

entries.name: Bastion
entries.desc:
Covered in thick plating, the Bastion is a fortress on legs. While it may be slow, it absolutely dominates wherever it patrols with heavy gatling-gun fire; turning anyone who gets in its way into Swiss cheese.

Based on Raider observations of its behavior, the Bastion is believed to be deployed where ARC detects potential resource deposits worth defending at all costs.

entries.name: Bombardier
entries.desc: Several theories exist as to how and why ARC deploys its Bombardiers, though all agree that it is a lethal piece of machinery that has sent countless Raiders to the infirmary.

entries.name: Spotter
entries.desc:
The Spotter will point a laser at any Raider in line-of-sight so the Bombardier can accurately target them.

If both Spotters are destroyed a new pair will respawn. When the Bombardier is destroyed the Spotters will fly away.

entries.name: Queen
entries.desc: The largest of the ARC. Only found guarding the Harvester during the relevant Event. Incredibly durable and lethal.
